header.title: The Scroll of Set, Issue Number 151, Volume XXIII-3, June 1997
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Temple of Set, Black Magic, Initiatory Systems

central_thesis: This issue of 'The Scroll of Set' primarily articulates the evolution and intensification of Setian initiation and self-creation (Xeper) through the Left-Hand Path. It details internal restructuring within the Order of the Sepulcher of the Obsidian Masque (OSOM) with new 'Mastery' criteria and the decentralization of initiatory work into autonomous 'Obsidian Sepulchers' to foster deeper, personalized 'Essent into Essence' experiences. Concurrently, it provides philosophical and practical guidance for Setians navigating contemporary challenges, integrating technology, and applying magical principles in the mundane world.

structure_content.summary: This article details a re-evaluation and future direction for the Order of the Sepulcher of the Obsidian Masque (OSOM). It introduces criteria for 'Mastery' within the OSOM, defines different types of 'Dromenon' (illustrative and PaXer), and outlines the process for forming autonomous 'Obsidian Sepulchers.' The article also announces the planned cessation of the OSOM itself in 1999, designed to push Dromenoi into a more intense and personalized 'Essent into Essence' process, with subsequent focus on individual Sepulchers and the Grand Master's isolation for personal research.
A brief listing of individuals recently recognized to the Adept II° degree within the Temple of Set.

Explores the philosophical parallels between Hindi 'Khapra' (destroyer beetle) and Egyptian 'Khepera' (scarab beetle, symbolizing rebirth and transformation). It connects these to the concept of Xeper, emphasizing conscious destruction and transformation guided by both 'Heart' (intuition) and 'Mind' (logic) as a necessary precursor to rebirth into a self-designed form.

Distinguishes between 'mechanical outcomes' (heredity, environment, karma) of the natural world and the 'non-natural phenomenon' of the 'Black Flame' or 'Gift of Set,' which represents isolate intelligence. It posits 'Coming Into Being' as the awakening of this unique, non-natural 'Spark' (the true self) to consciously transform the natural world in accordance with one's True Will, contrasting this active process with passive Right-Hand Path approaches.

Reviews WebTV as a user-friendly, affordable alternative to personal computers for Internet access and email. It highlights WebTV's simplicity, performance, and immunity to viruses, encouraging its adoption by Setians to engage with digital communication without technical complexities, viewing it as an improved, current technology.

structure_content.chapter_title: Dangerous Cult uses Internet to Lure Your Kids to Devil Worship
structure_content.summary: Addresses public and media hysteria surrounding 'cults' in the wake of the Heaven's Gate mass suicide. It warns Setians about the potential for the Temple of Set to be mischaracterized as a 'cult' by sensationalist media, emphasizing the need for vigilance and a realistic Left-Hand Path perspective given societal fears and millennial madness.

Presents reviews of various media, including a video series on 'The Occult History of the Third Reich' and several musical albums. The reviews offer a Setian perspective, highlighting themes of Germanic mysticism, runic symbolism, and occult aesthetics relevant to the Left-Hand Path.
A call for Setian artists to submit their artwork for an upcoming anthology, with contributors receiving a free copy upon publication.

A critical commentary on 'childish 'initiates'' who engage in gossip and trivial online chat, contrasting them with true Black Magicians who commit to genuine personal initiation. It emphasizes a strict adherence to the principles of the Prince of Darkness and the Priesthood of the Temple of Set.

An invitation for Setian artists, publishers, musicians, and media creators to submit their work for inclusion in the Sculpturesque Productions merchandise catalog, with the aim of selling their products internationally.

Announces the official website for the Order of the Trapezoid (Trapezoid.org), established as a central repository for information regarding the Order's aims and structure, encouraging visitor feedback.

Discusses the critical importance of proper address systems and adherence to protocol within the Temple of Set, particularly in online communications. It highlights how clarity in identification (name, degree, gender) prevents misinterpretation, fosters respect, and maintains stability among highly individualistic Initiates with diverse backgrounds.

structure_content.chapter_title: Application for Entrance: Xeper University City
structure_content.summary: A fictional prospectus for a 'Xeper University City,' dated 2015, outlining its mission to educate Black Magicians in the Left-Hand Path. It details the vision for a self-funded, accredited institution offering degrees in Black Magic, emphasizing continuous study and personal transformation as prerequisites for acceptance.
Announces that Magus Stephen Flowers' publishing house, Runa-Raven Press, now has its catalog available online via the Occult Institute of Technology's website.

Announces the new online location and redesigned webpage for the Temple of Set's bookstore, Avaris Booksellers. It features easy search capabilities and accepts various payment methods, also promoting a 'URL-Minder' service for tracking website updates.

Announces the second issue of 'The Black Petals,' the newsletter of the Black Lotus Project, dedicated to the exploration and application of Left-Hand Path oriented Yoga for the process of Becoming. It lists contributors and the price of the issue.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Eye in the Darkness: Maxims of SUA and ARI
structure_content.summary: Explores the Black Magical formula SUA (Seek, Uncover, Apply) and ARI, connecting it to the concept of initiation as dismemberment/rememberment (solve et coagula). It stresses the necessity of incorporating a working model of the cosmos and psyche to achieve proficiency in Black Arts, emphasizing a proactive, self-initiated approach to transformation.

structure_content.chapter_title: On the Closing of the Ba-neb-Tett Pylon
structure_content.summary: Details the unexpected closing of the Ba-neb-Tett Pylon following a 'Reformulative Working.' It frames this ending as a new beginning or 'Remanifestation,' highlighting that Pylons should facilitate an Initiate's Xeper, not hinder it, and that change is the only constant in the path of self-creation.

Don Webb V° offers guidance on approaching the millennium, urging Setians to view it as a time of beginnings rather than endings. He emphasizes the importance of practical, real-world achievement as proof of magic, and the concept of an 'expanding present' for Setians to integrate magical goals into their long-term vision, ensuring continuous development.
Announces the availability of the Order of the Trapezoid's first major corpus of work, a 184-page collection inspired by 'Azathoth,' for II°+ Initiates of the Temple of Set.

structure_content.chapter_title: Creating a Hand of Glory: A Black Magical Tool
structure_content.summary: Discusses the history, symbolism, and practical applications of the 'Hand of Glory' as a Black Magical tool. It outlines its uses for removing binds, binding enemies, instilling fear, and awakening, providing methods for its symbolic construction today and emphasizing its role as an extension of the magician's psyche.

Announces the formation of the Black Runa Pylon in Sweden, dedicated to exploring 'secret' or 'mystery within' (Sowhilo). Its aims include assisting Swedish Initiates to attain II° Recognition, pursuing the Grail quest, and translating Æonic words and philosophy into local tongues, focusing on Setian philosophy, Rune magic, and Germanic traditions.

Examines Rameses II's project of self-deification, associating him with the deities Set (representing permanence, stellar awareness) and Ra-Harakhte (representing action, solar power). It suggests that Rameses incorporated these two aspects of divinity to achieve immortal psychecentric being and the power to cause effects by command, offering this as a model for Setian Left-Hand Path initiation.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Theory of the Same Principles Repetition
structure_content.summary: Explores the concept that universal principles repeat across different dimensions, from subatomic to cosmic. It uses dimensional analogies (1DW, 2DW, 3DW) to conceptualize a hypothetical 4DW ('oversphere'), linking this abstract understanding to Pridgen's SUA formula (Seek, Uncover, Apply) as a means of comprehending nature and the universe.
A call for Setians interested in astronomy and/or astrology, or those residing in the Pennsylvania area, to make contact for networking and community building.

key_concepts.definition: The core Setian principle of self-creation and becoming; a conscious effort to inventory one's present state and expand possibilities, recognizing one's being as a result of past actions and experiences.

A primary OSOM process, describing the journey of an individual's unique being (Essent) into its fully manifest, objective reality (Essence); a transformative, personalized initiatory experience culminating in the Embodiment of Essence.

A recognition within the OSOM marking the completion of one phase of an Initiate's process and the beginning of another, requiring a formal request, II°+ standing, three years as a Dromenoi, experience of Essent into Essence, mentorship, presentations, and the formation of a personal Obsidian Sepulcher.

An initiatory experience or performance within the OSOM; can be 'illustrative' (a shared exploration of an initiatory dilemma) or 'PaXer' (a highly transformative experience where the initiate embodies the Dromenon, leading to Essent into Essence).

Autonomous groups proposed for III°+ Dromenoi, dedicated to the exploration and expression of a particular idea or process of utmost personal importance, serving as a vehicle for fulfilling Mastery criteria and sharing researches.

A non-natural phenomenon; isolate intelligence, the spark of individuality within Setians, emanating from outside the space-time continuum of the natural world, representing an intrinsic non-naturalness and potential for self-creation.

The recognition and awakening of one's unique, non-natural self ('Spark'), distinguishing oneself from the mechanical processes of the natural world, enabling conscious control and transformation of reality according to True Will.

A Black Magical formula guiding the process of engaging with mysteries; 'Seek that for which you have an Affinity,' 'Uncover Reality,' and 'Apply Information' to inspire/transform the individual and achieve proficiency in Black Arts.

An alchemical and initiatory process within the Left-Hand Path, involving dismemberment/rememberment, destruction/reconstruction, and analysis/synthesis, applied to the self and the cosmos to achieve peak awareness and Remanifestation.

A traditional magical tool (symbolic or literal) used in Black Magic for operative purposes, including removing binds, overcoming adversity, binding enemies, instilling fear, awakening, and causing sleep/stasis; seen as an extension of the psyche.

A Setian concept of enlarging one's sense of the present moment to encompass broader magical goals and long-term vision, enabling greater control over reality and resilience against setbacks, thereby enhancing the magical impact of one's work.

practical_system.description: The text outlines an operative system rooted in individual self-creation (Xeper) and the manifestation of one's unique essence in the world. It emphasizes intense introspection and internal transformation ('Essent into Essence'), guided by rigorous self-defined criteria for 'Mastery.' This involves practical engagement through 'Dromenon' (both communal and deeply personal initiatory experiences), mentorship, and the formation of autonomous 'Obsidian Sepulchers' for focused, personalized magical work. The system leverages Black Magical formulas like SUA ('Seek, Uncover, Apply') for systematic inquiry and transformation, and 'solve et coagula' for analytical and synthetic reconstruction of the self. Practitioners are encouraged to apply magical tools and principles to actively transform their 'World of Horrors' into a 'Garden of Delights,' demonstrating tangible achievement in the mundane world as proof of magical efficacy. The integration of modern tools like the Internet for communication and resource access is also highlighted, fostering a dynamic and adaptable approach to Left-Hand Path development.

relevant_quotes.text: The criteria the Dromenoi suggested is far more specific and demanding than any I would ever have devised.

The Eh-Ken-Tyr bind-rune... is an undefined symbol of the process of Essent into Essence and the eventual Embodiment of Essence. I will say no more, and from this point forth it will be the province of every Master of the Obsidian Sepulcher to define this mystery in unique terms.

Xeper is a process that involves firstly an inventory of what is presently in stock, and secondly the expansion of the possibilities that such stock offers. This is a conscious effort that requires an awareness of who and what you are, and what you are is a result of what you were.
The 'Gift of Set' is a non-natural phenomenon. In its essence it emanates from outside the framework of the natural world delineated by the space-time continuum.

To initiate means 'to begin'. Initiation, like Runa, can never be fully attained. To quote from the Crystal Tablet of Set: 'One never attains initiation per se; rather one attains a particular degree of initiation.'
Black Magic is an art/science that can aid us in the difficult process of initiation. It's impossible to get at the self directly, so we have to employ the 'mind mirror' aspect of GBM.
The Setian differs entirely from other sorts of magicians... The Setian must achieve this. It is a necessary proof of his magic: not to someone in the Temple watching, but to himself.
Hands of Glory have the power of making everyone who saw [them] unable to move, [and] also had the property of opening any lock to which they were held.

critical_analysis.relevance: This issue is highly relevant for understanding the internal dynamics and philosophical evolution of the Temple of Set during a period of significant change. It marks a shift towards decentralization, personalized initiatory work ('Essent into Essence'), and the establishment of rigorous criteria for 'Mastery' within specific Orders. The emphasis on practical application of magic in the mundane world, integration of technology, and proactive engagement with societal perceptions of occultism demonstrates a pragmatic and evolving approach to Left-Hand Path practice. The articles provide detailed insights into Setian metaphysics (Xeper, Black Flame), ethics, and operative techniques, making it an invaluable resource for practitioners seeking to deepen their understanding and practice within this tradition.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is active members of the Temple of Set, especially Dromenoi within the OSOM, and those aspiring to higher degrees or greater engagement with Setian philosophy and practice. It also addresses Setian artists, scholars, and those interested in the organizational and practical aspects of a modern Left-Hand Path group. Some articles, particularly those on public perception and technology, offer insights beneficial to a broader occult audience concerned with the interface between esoteric practice and contemporary society.
